prover.gui
Class TopLevelManager

java.lang.Object
  ViewPart
      prover.gui.TopLevelManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IColorConstants, IStreamListener
public class TopLevelManager
extends ViewPart
implements IStreamListener, IColorConstants

The top level manager is the main class of the gui of ProverEditor. It controls the top level, it glue the editor with the commands. And it is a view part to show the current prover state.

See Also:
Serialized Form

progress

public boolean progress(ProverFileContext pc)
Progress in the proof. If the progress was successful return true, otherwise returns false.

Parameters:
pc - the context in which to progress.
Returns:
true if the progress was successful, false otherwise or if the lock was already set.

progress_intern

protected boolean progress_intern(ProverFileContext pc)

regress

public boolean regress(ProverFileContext pc)
Regress in the proof. If the undo was successful returns true, otherwise returns false.

Parameters:
pc - the context in which to undo a command.
Returns:
true if the undo was successful, false otherwise or if the lock was already set.

regress_intern

protected boolean regress_intern(ProverFileContext pc)

respawn

public void respawn()
Tries to respawn the top level. First stop the toplevel if it is running, and after start it again.

append

public void append(String str)
Add the string given as an argument to the text viewer used to show the state of the prover.

Parameters:
str - The string to add to the text viewer of the prover.

reset

public void reset(ProverFileContext pc)
Reset the top level and the view with the context passed as a parameter.

Parameters:
pc - The prover context which we have to reset the view with
See Also:

isNewDoc

public boolean isNewDoc(ProverFileContext pc)
Tells whether or not the doc from the field prover.gui.TopLevelManager#fProverContext is the same as the doc in the context given as a parameter.

Parameters:
pc - The context to test
Returns:
true if the documents are different.

isUnicodeMode

public boolean isUnicodeMode()
Tell whether or not we shall use unicode characters.

Returns:
True if the unicode checkbox in the preferences is checked.

doBreak

Tries to send a Ctrl-Break command to the prover.
